Remdesivir is efficacious for severe COVID-19 in adults, but data in pregnant women are limited.
We describe outcomes in the first 86 pregnant women with severe COVID-19 who were treated with remdesivir.

Reported data span March 21 to June 16, 2020 for hospitalized pregnant women with PCR-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and room air oxygen saturation ≤94% whose clinicians requested remdesivir through the compassionate use program.
Among 86 pregnant and postpartum women with severe COVID-19 who received compassionate use remdesivir, recovery rates were high, with a low rate of serious adverse events.
